title: 4 Easy Ways to Make Two Columns in Word on Desktop or Mobile

steps.title: Open the Microsoft Word document you want to edit.
steps.content: Open the Microsoft Word document you want to edit. Find the Word document you want to edit on your computer, and double-click on its icon to open it. [1] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source If you don't have Microsoft Word on your Windows or Mac computer, you can download it or use the free web version at [2] X Research source . You can also add images to your document if you're planning to create a "news column" type document.

steps.title: Select all the text you want to split into columns.
steps.content: Select all the text you want to split into columns. Click the beginning of the text you want to edit, and drag your mouse until the end of it. Selected parts will be highlighted. [3] X Research source If you want to apply the columns to the entire document (the current page and subsequent pages), you don't need to select anything.

steps.title: Click the Layout tab at the top.
steps.content: Click the Layout tab at the top. This button is located above the toolbar at the top of your document. [4] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source Depending on your version of Word, this button may also be labeled Page Layout .

steps.title: Click the Columns button on the Layout toolbar.
steps.content: Click the Columns button on the Layout toolbar. This looks like a rectangle with horizontal lines divided in two sets. A drop-down menu will open.

steps.title: Select Two on the drop-down menu.
steps.content: Select Two on the drop-down menu. This will split the selected text into two columns. Alternatively, you can select another option here, and create even more columns. You can select: One (default), Two , Three , Left , Right , or More Columns .

steps.title: Change the size of your columns (optional).
steps.content: Change the size of your columns (optional). You can click and drag the edges of the ruler at the top of your document to change the size of your columns. If you don't see the ruler, click the View tab, then click the box next to Ruler in the Show section. Make sure you still have your column text selected when you adjust the size. This is an optional adjustment. If you prefer not to change the column sizes, your columns will be equal in size by default. Be sure to save your Word document when you're finished.

steps.title: Open a document in the Microsoft Word app.
steps.content: Open a document in the Microsoft Word app. This looks like a blue notebook next to a W . Microsoft Word is available for iOS in the App Store and for Android in the Google Play Store . [5] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source Tap Blank document to open a new document or tap a file to open an existing document. This method will adjust the entire document's layout without needing to select text. If you want to make specific text into a column, use a table instead.

steps.title: Tap the arrow icon.
steps.content: Tap the arrow icon. This can be found above the keyboard, to the right. On some devices, this may look like a three-dots icon. If you don't see your keyboard, tap the document to bring it up. A new menu will open.

steps.title: Tap Home.
steps.content: Tap Home . This will be to the left of the formatting window. A drop-down menu will open.

steps.title: Tap Layout.
steps.content: Tap Layout . You'll see a list of options you can make to your page layout.

steps.title: Tap Columns.
steps.content: Tap Columns . This will be next to the icon of horizontal lines divided in two sets.

steps.title: Tap Two.
steps.content: Tap Two . This will split the selected text into two columns. Alternatively, you can select another option here, and split your text into more columns. You can select: One (default), Two , Three , Left , or Right . Your page layout will now have two columns. When you enter text, it will fill the left column first, then continue onto the right column.

steps.title: Click where you want the table.
steps.content: Click where you want the table. This can always be moved later.

steps.title: Click Insert.
steps.content: Click Insert . This is the tab at the top. If you don't want to edit the entire document or page, you can use a table to create a column that can be manipulated independently from the rest of the document.

steps.title: Click Table.
steps.content: Click Table . You can find this in the Tables section. A drop-down menu will open.

steps.title: Select a 2x1 table.
steps.content: Select a 2x1 table. This is two squares going across and one square down.

steps.title: Enter your text and formatting.
steps.content: Enter your text and formatting. Place your text in each box as you would for a normal column.. To adjust the size of each column, click and drag any of the lines inwards or outwards.

steps.title: Remove the borders.
steps.content: Remove the borders. This is how you'll achieve the look of a column. To remove the borders, do the following: Select the table. Click the down-arrow next to the Borders icon. Select No Border .

steps.title: Tap where you want the table.
steps.content: Tap where you want the table. This can always be moved later.

steps.title: Tap the arrow icon.
steps.content: Tap the arrow icon. This can be found above the keyboard, to the right. On some devices, this may look like a three-dots icon. If you don't see your keyboard, tap the document to bring it up. If you don't want to edit the entire document or page, you can use a table to create a column that can be manipulated independently from the rest of the document.

steps.title: Tap Home.
steps.content: Tap Home . This will be to the left of the formatting window. A drop-down menu will open.

steps.title: Tap Insert.
steps.content: Tap Insert . You'll see a list of options you can add to your page layout.

steps.title: Tap Table.
steps.content: Tap Table . This is the second option.

steps.title: Create a 2x1 table.
steps.content: Create a 2x1 table. This is 1 row going down and 2 columns going across. Tap the + or - buttons to adjust the number accordingly.

steps.title: Tap Insert Table.
steps.content: Tap Insert Table . The table will be added to your page.

steps.title: Enter your text and formatting.
steps.content: Enter your text and formatting. Place your text in each box as you would for a normal column. To adjust the size of each column, tap and drag any of the lines inwards or outwards.

steps.title: Remove the borders.
steps.content: Remove the borders. This is how you'll achieve the look of a column. To remove the borders, do the following: Select the table by tapping the arrow icon at the top-left corner of the table. Tap the down-arrow or three-dots icon to open the Table menu. Tap Table Styles . Select the style with no lines (under the Plain Tables header).
